content.1: The burden of the word of the
content.2: And Hamath also shall border thereby; Tyrus, and Zidon, though it be very wise.
content.3: And Tyrus did build herself a strong hold, and heaped up silver as the dust, and fine gold as the mire of the streets.
content.4: Behold, the Lord will cast her out, and he will smite her power in the sea; and she shall be devoured with fire.
content.6: And a bastard shall dwell in Ashdod, and I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.
content.7: And I will take away his blood out of his mouth, and his abominations from between his teeth: but he that remaineth, even he,
content.8: And I will encamp about mine house because of the army, because of him that passeth by, and because of him that returneth: and no oppressor shall pass through them any more: for now have I seen with mine eyes.
content.9: Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion; shout, O daughter of Jerusalem: behold, thy King cometh unto thee: he
content.10: And I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim, and the horse from Jerusalem, and the battle bow shall be cut off: and he shall speak peace unto the heathen: and his dominion
content.11: As for thee also, by the blood of thy covenant I have sent forth thy prisoners out of the pit wherein
content.12: Turn you to the strong hold, ye prisoners of hope: even to day do I declare
content.13: When I have bent Judah for me, filled the bow with Ephraim, and raised up thy sons, O Zion, against thy sons, O Greece, and made thee as the sword of a mighty man.
